intro: Erodium cicutarium subsp. bipinnatum, commonly known as the two-pinnate bedstraw, is a flowering plant in the family Geraniaceae. It is native to southern Europe and western Asia, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. The plant has small, pink or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are trifoliate or bipinnate, giving it a finely divided appearance. It is an annual herb that can spread through seeds dispersed by wind or animals.
